result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryant C Smith Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bryant C. Smith, Jr. in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:46 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.

Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 2.
Count 3 will be dismissed and read in.

Atty Halverson concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1
Defnedant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court has a number of factors to consider.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 30 days
Huber granted for employment and any counseling
May be served in Oneida County or Portage County
20 days credit
Report to jail today in Portage County
Sentence to commence within 45 days
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up payment plan
Money that was confiscated will be released from evidence in this case and returned to Politos as the restitution

Count 2:
Jail sentence of 30 days, cosecutive to Count 1
Huber granted for employment and any counseling
May be served in Oneida County or Portage County
20 days credit
Report to jail today in Portage County
Sentence to commence within 45 days
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up payment plan

20 days to appeal the case
Any money posted is to be applied to fine/costs.
updated address for defendant's employer provided by his attorney on 02/15/16 - mailed wage assignment with letter on 02/16/16

Attorney Acalia N Halverson in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:39 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Halverson indicates the defendant did call and indicated his ride was not willing to bring him due to the weather. 
Court questions parties re: agreement. 
Atty Cousins states the agreement. 
Atty Halverson makes statements to the Court. 

Court will reschedule the matter.   Court addresses the wage assignment.  
Clerk notes the wage assignment was returned.  No payments, other than the $150 have been posted. 
Court asks Atty Halverson to speak with her client re: his employment and to notify the Clerks office. 

BY THE COURT: Bond continued with the caviat that the wage assignment is to be sent to the correct place so that can be sent out by the end of the week. 
Atty Halverson indicates she will speak to her client this afternoon.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Wage Assignment mailed to Kholes @ 2121 Leaken Street, Rhinelander, WI  54501 **returned by post office as return to sender, no such street, unable to forward
letter to Kholes in re:  wage assignment

$500 cash bond: $150 cash bond must be paid prior to being release and then wage assignment at $50 per paycheck. No contact with Politos in Stevens Point or any of its employees other than incidental contact.

1:44 p.m. Prosecuting Atty Louis J. Molepske appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bryant C. Smith, Jr. appeared by video. Attorney Acalia N Halverson not in court. Defendant states he turned himself in and he was not told about his last court hearing.
State requests a cash bond.
BTC: $500 cash bond: $150 cash bond must be paid prior to being release and then wage assignment at $50 per paycheck. No contact with Politos in Stevens Point or any of its employees.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Acalia Halverson in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:01 p.m.  Court calls the case.  

Court reviews the file. 
Atty Halverson indicates she did verify the defendant is not in custody. 
Atty Cousins recommends a body only warrant given the history of his failing to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Bench Warrant.  $150 cash bond is ordered forfeited. $500 cash alternative is now ordered.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bryant C. Smith, Jr. appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Acalia Halverson in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered.
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Bryant C. Smith, Jr. appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Warrant quashed. BTC: $150 cash bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Warrant w/$1,000 cash alternative - sent to JR 07-14-13
Defendant Bryant C. Smith, Jr. not in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BTC: Warrant w/$1,000 cash alternative
No contact with Politos in Stevens Point or any of its employees.

ADA Elizabeth Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Theft, Bail Jumping.
Court advises defendant of right to remain silent or make a statement.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  7/13/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1

Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
